balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}. Requirements: - `account` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

bridgedSupply(uint256).details: Returns the bridged quantity for a token ID

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to query

burn(address,uint256,uint256).details: Burns some amount of tokens from an address

params._from: The address to burn tokens from

burnBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[]).details: Burn tokens for each id in _ids

params._from: The address to burn tokens from
params._quantities: Array of amounts to burn per id

create(uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes).details: Creates a new token type and assigns _initial to a sender

params._data: Optional data to pass if receiver is contract
params._initial: how many tokens to mint initially

createBatch(uint256[],uint256[],uint256[.details: Creates some amount of tokens type and assigns initials to a sender

params._mints: how many tokens to mint initially

exists(uint256).details: Returns whether the specified token exists by checking to see if it has a creator

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to query the existence of

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

maxSupply(uint256).details: Returns the max quantity for a token ID

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to query

mint(address,uint256,uint256,bytes).details: Mints some amount of tokens to an address

params._data: Data to pass if receiver is contract
params._to: Address of the future owner of the token

mintBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[],by.details: Mint tokens for each id in _ids

params._data: Data to pass if receiver is contract
params._quantities: Array of amounts of tokens to mint per id
params._to: The address to mint tokens to

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

reservedSupply(uint256).details: Returns the reserved quantity for a token ID

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to query

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setBaseMetadataURI(string).details: Will update the base URL of token's URI

params._newBaseMetadataURI: New base URL of token's URI

setReservedSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Will update _reservedSupply for the given tokenID

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to update

totalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total quantity for a token ID

params._id: uint256 ID of the token to query

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Override isApprovedForAll to whitelist user's OpenSea proxy accounts to enable gas-free listings.
